profiles:
Summary I joined Google in September 2010 and am currently working as an Agency Account Strategist for small and medium business sales in the NA region. In my previous roles at Google, I have worked in SMB Sales for the AU/NZ region and have also worked in the Ad Review Operations function before moving in to sales. Prior to Google, I worked as a Relationship Manager in the Global Private Clients Group (Private Banking) with ICICI Bank Ltd. in Hyderabad, India between July 2008 to September 2010.  
 
I hold an MBA from the ICFAI Business School, Hyderabad and a B.Com. (Hons.) degree from the Bhawanipur Education Society College, Calcutta University. I also hold a Diploma in Mass Communication from the Birla Institute of Liberal Arts & Management Sciences, Kolkata.  
 
Usually like to describe myself as a jack of all trades, always looking to try my hand at different activities. I am a big time Bollywood movie buff, cricket enthusiast and my claim to fame is jumping off a plane from 18000 feet (the world's highest tandem jump). Experience AdWords Account Strategist- Agency Sales Google April 2015  – Present (5 months) Mountain View, CA AdWords Account Strategist- Small Business Sales Google October 2014  –  March 2015  (6 months) Mountain View, CA Core Role: 
- Work over the phone with small and medium sized businesses, and provide them with strategic suggestions and opportunities for improving their AdWords account. Manage a $14M/quarter portfolio and consistently grow the book at 20% YOY. 
- Attain 100%+ on revenue consistently for the book of business. 
- Treat accounts that have rapidly increased or decreased their advertising spend, resulting in the highest revenue impact out of all scaled sales teams at Google. 
- Finished at the top 10 percentile on the team for all productivity metrics and customer happiness. 
- Rated consistently at “exceeds expectations” or higher for the previous 4 quarters. 
 
Additional Projects/Awards: 
 
1. Technical Expert- Project Lapse Team	 
- Co-lead 'Project Relapse,' an initiative aimed at reversing lapsed rates in SMB accounts. The scaled business unit lost Millions of dollars in revenue due to deactivations just in Q4 2014, and this project is aimed at mitigating this revenue loss.  
- Focus primarily on the technical reasons why advertisers stop spending with AdWords, and we are building a structured approach to handling these objections to help revitalize the advertiser’s confidence in the product. 
 
2. Team Lead- Campaign Optimization Team  
- Main responsibility of the team is to work on sharing best practices to increase the number of AdWords campaign optimization wins. Optimization wins are a team OKR and major priority for the team. 
- Team experienced a 212% YOY increase in the total number of optimization wins. 
 
3. Inducted into the Customer Satisfaction Club by achieving above 98% customer satisfaction score. AdWords Account Strategist- Small Business Services Google September 2013  –  October 2014  (1 year 2 months) Mountain View, CA Core Role: 
- Provided technical phone and chat support and educated small and medium sized business advertisers about a variety of Google products including AdWords, Merchant Center, Analytics, G+, and YouTube. 
- Leveraged product knowledge to provide strategic suggestions to improve the advertiser’s overall account performance, and drive sales or leads, while at the same time increasing Google’s revenues. 
- Achieved above average metrics for the three key measurable areas; customer satisfaction, efficiency, and revenue, resulting in an “Exceeds Expectations” for my first performance cycle.  
- Worked specifically on a rotation that focused on the core AdWords product and gaining a complete understanding of its features and available solutions for the SMB’s. 
 
Additional Projects/Awards: 
 
1. Project Outreach Coordinator- GCE Innovation Team 
- Processed over 50 idea submissions through the innovation platform, which focuses on finding new ways to improve internal processes, workflow, and product. 
- Collaborated with cross-functional teams to determine the viability, potential impact, popularity and leadership buy-in for the different idea submissions, and developed next steps for pursuing them. 
 
2. Intern Buddy- BOLD Internship Program  
- Held bi-weekly meetings where we discussed work at Google, provided support for the core role, acted as a mentor, and provided real-time feedback to my intern. 
- Completed feedback at the end of the internship. 
 
3. Optimization Guru- SRP Optimization Team 
- Led 10 half-hour 1:1 consultations with other teammates who were trying to improve their revenue metrics, and developed and documented customized strategies tailored to the team member’s areas of development.  
- Due to my strong performance in the revenue program, I was asked to join the team of experts comprised of the top 14 performers in NA. 
 
4. 5-time Award Winner for top revenue performer in NA. 
 
5. 100% customer satisfaction for two separate months. 
 BOLD Services Team Intern Google May 2012  –  August 2012  (4 months) Ann Arbor, MI - Provided technical phone support and educated small and medium sized business advertisers about a variety of Google products including AdWords, Merchant Center, Analytics, G+, and YouTube. 
- Was converted to a full-time employee following the internship. - Worked quickly and efficiently with other co-workers to fulfill the customer's needs, and swiftly biked deliveries to customers. - Learned to drive a forklift and backhoe and to use various power tools to successfully complete miscellaneous projects. Volunteer- Renewable Energy for the Developing World Workshop Solar Energy International (SEI) May 2010  –  May 2010  (1 month) Durika, Costa Rica - Studied wind, hydroelectric, biomass, and solar energy sources in a classroom setting while abroad. 
- Worked with the local community and 30 other team members to install these energy sources for locals. Summary Sohail Singh is a long time Googler who has worked on shaping the evolution of Google’s products as a product specialist involved in multiple product areas. Sohail has years of experience in launching both Hardware & Software products in the Asia pacific region and was involved in the early days of multiple product areas. In his current position at Google, Singapore he works on launching Google hardware products across the Asia pacific region which includes but is not limited to Nexus Phones, chromebooks and chromecast. Sohail is a geek who loves technology and is very passionate about the possibilities that the internet creates.  
 
He has delivered invited guest lecturers at various business schools on digital marketing and the ways by which the internet is impacting how we work, communicate and live.

Summary Brent Davis is a Senior SEM consultant at Google. He focuses on Online Sales & Marketing in the Life Sciences and Healthcare space. He has expertise in Mobile, Analytics and Search. He also advises Google Ventures portfolio companies. Brent is based out of Google Headquarters in Mountain View, CA. 
 
At Google, he has helped hundreds of Life Science companies via building and launching sales/marketing initiatives that span Search, Mobile, Display, Video & Social Media. 
 
In addition to serving as resident Life Science expert, Brent has led numerous workflow-system optimization efforts. He was chosen to travel to Hyderabad, India to revamp and train the India Healthcare Team. Brent also regularly liaises with engineers to increase the velocity of Online Marketing product development. 
 
Prior to joining Google, Brent earned a B.S. with honors in Molecular Biology and then went on to earn a M.S. in Biotechnology Enterprise from the Johns Hopkins University where he graduated with Highest Distinction Honors (GPA: 3.95).
